name: Kiran Pahal
biography: Kiran Pahal is an emerging Indian athlete specializing in the 400 meters run. She is known for her remarkable performances, having qualified for the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris with a personal best of 50.92 seconds, making her the second fastest Indian woman in this event.
childhood: Kiran Pahal hails from Rohtak, Haryana. After the passing of her father, she faced challenges in her family life and trains independently under her coach Akaash Chikara. Despite having no sponsors, she has shown resilience and determination in her athletic career.
professional_career: Kiran is a three-time National champion and has achieved significant milestones, including winning the women's 400m gold at the National Championships. She made headlines by clocking 50.92 seconds at the National Inter-State Athletics Championships, qualifying her for the Olympics and marking her as one of the top athletes in India.
